messages.message: All services run Python 3 by default (runlocal only, not on Docker yet) now except for image tasks and app tasks
If you see issues pop up please send on this channel or the Python 3 channel. Also, if you are curious if a surprise bug is Python 3 related, feel free to use runlocal-py2.

@dlluncor Do you know of any good articles about learning to take advantage of new Python 3 features? There are a lot of cool spread and rest operators, right?

(Also: should we avoid using python3 specific code until we’re 100% transitioned on clients?)

If the bug goes away after switching to runlocal-py2 , then it's basically Python 3 is the issue. If we could send all the bugs immediately to a channel happy to help and provide ideas about debugging so we can spread the load of debugging. Alert early and often thanks!
Yes we should only use Py2 / Py3 supported code right now, all of our code is in that mode currently

The biggest deal about PY3 is that: newest tools only support PY3. Unicode strings are the default str type (super important for us because we have so many Unicode problems and it's totally busted across our PY2 codebase). There's some performance enhancements, but those are a wash essentially. And a couple new libraries

Observation that might only relate to how I develop: I tend to leave all my services running and only restart those that are necessary… I found w/ the Py2->Py3 switch I have to restart everything to make sure I don’t get any funny business (maybe relates to serialization over celery? dunno..). In any event.. if someone experiences a problem and you haven’t restarted every service, that might be useful.

@dlluncor We should make sure that we are running py-tests in both mode if we are going to be in the dual mode for a few weeks.  This will make sure that when we make a change to Py3 (which will be the default mode), we are not breaking anything in py2 world.  Not completely sure how to do this given our Jenkins setup currently.
